title: Implement pagination for devlogs API to improve performance
description:
The current API loads all devlogs at once into the browser which is inefficient and will cause performance issues as the number of devlogs grows. Need to implement proper pagination with:

1. Backend API pagination support (limit, offset, cursor-based)
2. Frontend pagination UI controls 
3. Efficient data loading and caching
4. Maintain real-time updates with SSE while supporting pagination

notes.content: Started implementation: Created feature branch and worktree. Now implementing pagination at all layers starting with core types.

3. Enhance API endpoints with pagination parameters
4. Update frontend hooks and components
5. Add pagination UI controls

context.businessContext:
As the project scales and accumulates more devlogs, loading all entries at once will cause:
- Slow initial page loads
- High memory usage in browser
- Poor user experience
- Network bandwidth waste
- Potential browser crashes with large datasets
context.technicalContext:
Current implementation:
- DevlogManager.listDevlogs() returns all entries matching filter
- API /api/devlogs returns complete result set
- Frontend useDevlogsWithSearch hook fetches all data at once
- No pagination controls in UI

Need to implement proper pagination at all layers while maintaining existing functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: API supports pagination parameters (page, limit, offset)
Data loads incrementally with good UX
Search and filtering work with pagination
Real-time updates (SSE) work with paginated data
Backward compatibility maintained for existing API consumers
